result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wayne Anthony Carter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wayne Anthony Carter in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Wayne Anthony Carter.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Final pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Jury trial scheduled for 11-14-2022 at 9:00 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed
State's Witness List, received and filed

Defendant Wayne Anthony Carter in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Wayne Anthony Carter in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer. Parties are engaged in negotiations. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Wayne Anthony Carter in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defendant advised his attorney is in a different court. Court ordered matter adjourned. 
Defense counsel notified of the next court date. This hearing will be held Electronically- via zoom.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.
Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY ANIMALS.

Defendant Wayne Anthony Carter in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Wayne Anthony Carter in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wayne Anthony Carter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
